title: Exclamdown and questiondown revisited
content:
An old thread [http://www.typophile.com/node/34363](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017043209/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34363 "http://www.typophile.com/node/34363") didn't seem to resolve this issue, wandering off as threads are wont to do . . .

Recently, we set a book for a publisher in southwest, where a number of editors at the press have a Spanish background. (As far as I know though, most of their formal schooling was Anglo.) Anyway, they felt that when a excalm- or questiondown was followed by a capital letter, the exclam- questiondown should ride on the baseline, otherwise, it should not.

We wrote a simple calt feature to take care of this

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017043209im_/http:/typophile.com/files/down_5956.gif)
  
Where (F) is foundry, and (1) and (2) show the added calt feature.

Any thoughts before we consider adding this to other fonts (where the license permits).
author: charles ellertson
